definition: Pattern where breaches are quietly ignored or forgiven without process, undermining the treaty.

positive_examples: Known violations stay off the shared log.
Secretariat asks reporters to drop complaints.
Problematic tribes are shielded to preserve appearances.
Telemetry anomalies go uninvestigated for months.
Breach reporters are told to use private channels only.
Status reports celebrate positives and omit failures.
Breaches trigger handshake deals instead of enforcement.
Closed sessions strike breaches from the record.
Treaty dashboard lights stay green despite evidence.
External partners notice noncompliance before signatories do.
negative_examples: All breaches are logged within agreed SLA.
Violations are described factually and addressed.
Reporters can escalate publicly without fear.
Status reports balance successes and failures.
Dashboards change color when metrics warrant.
Signatories detect noncompliance before outsiders do.
